column2: qŭia mirabìlia fecit. Salvávit sìbi dèxtera ejus
column3: et bráchium sanctum ejus. ^ Sing ye to the Lord a new canticle
column4: because he hath done wonderful things. His right hand hath wrought for him salvation

column1: 2 ^ Notum fecit Dòminus salutáre suum~; in conspèctu gèntium revelávit justìtiam suam. ^ The Lord hath made known his salvation~; he hath revealed his justice in the sight of the Gentiles.

3 ^ Recordátus est misericórdiaĕ suaĕ et veritátis suaĕ dómui Israhélis. Vîdérunt omnes tèrmini terraĕ salutáre Dei nostri. ^ He hath remembered his mercy and his truth toward the house of Israel. All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

column3: et psállite. ^ Sing joyfully to God all the earth~; make melody

column2: in cìttara et voce psalmi. ^ Sing praise to the Lord on the harp
column4: and with the voice of a psalm.

column1: 6 ^ In tubîs ductìlibus et voce tubaĕ córneaĕ
column2: jubiláte in conspèctu regis Dòmini. ^ With long trumpets
column3: and sound of cornet. Make a joyful noise before the sight of the king

column1: 7 ^ Moveátur mare et plenitúdo ejus~; orbis terrárum et qŭi hábitant in eo. ^ Let the sea be moved and the fullness thereof~; the world and they that dwell therein.
8 ^ Flúmina plaŭdent manu~; sìmul montes exsultábunt a conspèctu Dòmini
column2: ^ The rivers shall clap their hands~; the mountains shall rejoice together at the presence of the Lord

column1: 9 ^ qŭóniam vênit judicáre terram. Judicábit orbem terrárum in justìtia
column2: et pòpulos in aĕqŭitáte. ^ because he cometh to judge the earth. He shall judge the world with justice
